intro: Centaurea leucophaea var. oscillans, commonly known as the oscillating bluemink, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features striking blue to purple flower heads surrounded by white to pale blue ray florets, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branched stems and narrow, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
